https://www.att.com/support/article/dsl-high-speed/KM1010523/

content:
Then you are in for a disappointment if you use Google as they have a mail paradigm that makes a single mail in IMAP something that does not exist. They create folders in their web interface on the fly basing everything on labels on an individual email in the All Mail database, but those emails become several emails once they are turned into IMAP which has no concept of labels and a central mail database and labels.

Note: As far as Google is concerned, unless you change setting on their web site. Once all labels are removed from an email is remains in all mail as an archive. That also means that the mail can not appear in the trash as that is just another label to Google.

Thunderbird defaults to moving deleted mail to the trash folder, when you empty the trash then Google will remove the trash label, and through use of web based setting Google can be convinced to remove mail after it is deleted and expunged from the trash.

I do not know of a way to have say the important label removed if you choose to use that inbox system Google has. Personally I just turned it off.

If you were to use a real IMAP implementation, not a "sort of" implementation as Google has you would do better, but that would require you to change mail providers to someone who has true IMAP, like GMX. The one offered by Micrisift is also not a true IMAP with other deficiencies other than those I discuss about Google.

Fundamentally email is a complex creature and how may expect it to work is far from the reality of what actually happens.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I have the following Server Settings enabled:

Check for new messages at startup Check for new messages every 5 minutes Allow immediate server notifications when new messages arrive
creator: vixeny

content:
What you are describing sounds to me like the server is overloaded and not forwarding changes in a timely manner.

Many years ago I had something similar with Hotmail where they would take up to half an hour to act on mail deletions. This meant that I was getting two copies of mail in Thunderbird because the server was still reporting the deleted mail.

In this case Thunderbird updates based on your action, sends off the deletion and requests an update on the folder (it is clearly no longer in sync, you deleted something. The server sends the old information and then some time latter notifies of a change and the email disappears.

Do you have the frequency of checking mail set to less than 10-15 minutes? That is something that might underlay an issue like this.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Is the password showing in the password manager?

Often requests for passwords are actually not related to the password, but general failures to connect. From DNS issues where the server is not found to certificates being out of date for encryption or the wrong connection security being used.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Thunderbird stores passwords for mail accounts. It does not have it';s own passwords for your mail accounts. So if your mail account needs a new password, the reset occurs with the mail provider.

The exception is if you create a master password, err primary password, but few folk do this and you can clear them fairly simply. See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/protect-your-thunderbird-passwords-primary-password#w_removing-your-primary-password

It is possible that the connection setting you have are simply not correct, which will see you prompted for a password because the automatic connection failed. But I can make no comment on that as you have not supplied you current setting, nor your email provider.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Contacts from where?

While some email providers do make contacts associated with the email address available via carddav and Thunderbird can access them, it is an option in the setup of the account. The same as calendars for those providers. Did you select that option?

IMAP folders are fully populated after you successfully connect and download mail. do you have all your mail downloaded? When you right click the account in the folder view, and select subscribe are the folders you wish to see subscribed?
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Could you please do the following?

  1. Open the menu > Help > Troubleshooting Information, then click Copy text to Clipboard.
  2. Go to https://pastebin.mozilla.org/, chage the retention period to "expire in 21 days" paste the info from your Troubleshooting Information page, use the Paste Snippet button to create a page containing your info, then copy the resulting URL (address) of the page created.
  3. Open a reply to this post, and paste the link to your troubleshooting information you just copied.

Next, we'll need you to provide answers to the following question:

  • Does Thunderbird work in troubleshooting mode?
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Non sono a conoscenza di problemi di stabilità particolari in Thunderbird 115. In generale la versione 115 essendo nuova e molto carica di novità è meno stabile della precedente ma i vari problemi emersi vengono risolti con i vari aggiornamenti.

L'unica circostanza in cui ci sono segnalazioni frequenti di problemi è dagli utenti che hanno aggiornato a Thunderbird 115 una versione precedente. Come è chiaramente scritto nelle note di rilascio (https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/115.1.1/releasenotes/) Thunderbird 115 è attualmente consigliata solo per installazioni da zero. Quando sarà pronta per aggiornare le versioni precedenti, la notifica di disponibilità dell'aggiornamento arriverà direttamente dall'applicazione.
creator: @next

content:
You image does not show a spam folder either, or a sent mail. Check that all the "basic" folders have the color icons beside them. The yellow folder icon against something like inbox, drafts, sent mail, spam, trash or bin are an indication of other setting not being correct.

Right click the account in the folder pane, select subscribe. Are these folders shown there and subscribed.

Note that I have a number of Gmail accounts in Thunderbird mostly for various testing, but I just noticed one of them has a "bin" folder instead of trash. So it might be a name mismatch in settings. But first make sure all the correct folders are subscribed.
creator: MattAuSupport
